intro: Erythrospermum polyandrum, commonly known as the red-flowered hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bright red flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant has palmate leaves and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its vibrant floral display makes it a striking addition to coastal gardens and natural landscapes.
